channel.title: Timers-Odd and Even Numbers

item.title: Timers-Odd and Even Numbers
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:15, topic:233764”][quote author=x blitz x link=topic=308266.msg2464527#msg2464527 date=1222642402]
Why is everyone using crappy timers. Why not use Timer and TimerTask.
[/quote]
Well done.[/quote]
Thanks.

import java.util.Timer;
import java.util.TimerTask;

/**
 * Created by IntelliJ IDEA.
 * User: Steven
 * Date: 29-Sep-2008
 * Time: 07:24:07
 */

public class TimerTaskExample {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        int delay = 5000;   // delay for 5 sec.
        int period = 10000;  // repeat every 10 sec.
        Timer timer = new Timer();

        timer.scheduleAtFixedRate(new TimerTask() {
            public void run() {
                // Task Here...
            }
        }, delay, period);
    }
}

item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

if(500msTimer >= 0) { 500msTimer -= 1; }

Declare that in boolean process…

fixed your code aswell

[code]if(absX == 2081 && absX == 3227) {
if (sitinchairtimer == 100) {
500msTimer = 200;
forceWalk(0, -1);
sitinchairtimer-= 1;
}
if (sitinchairtimer == 99) && (500msTimer == 0) {
setAnimation(3375);
}
}

if(absX == 2080) && (absX == 3227) { 
if (sitinchairtimer == 100) {
500msTimer = 200;
forceWalk(0, -1);
sitinchairtimer-= 1;
}
if (sitinchairtimer == 99) && (500msTimer == 0) { 
setAnimation(3375);
}
}

if(absX == 2081) && (absX == 3225) { 
if (sitinchairtimer == 100) {
500msTimer = 200;
forceWalk(0, 1);
sitinchairtimer-= 1;
}
if (sitinchairtimer == 99) && (500msTimer == 0) { 
setAnimation(3375);
}
}

if(absX == 2080) && (absX == 3225) { 
if (sitinchairtimer == 100) {
500msTimer = 200;
forceWalk(0, -1);
sitinchairtimer-= 1;
}
if (sitinchairtimer == 99) && (500msTimer == 0) { 
setAnimation(3375);
}
}

break;[/code]

item.title: Timers-Odd and Even Numbers
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

if(500msTimer >= 0) { 500msTimer -= 1; }

Means; If the timer is above 0, then count it down by 1 every 500ms.

So if you set it to:

100: Half a second
200: Whole second

Etc

Read full topic

item.title: Timers-Odd and Even Numbers
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

A loop that gets called upon when you do that, and decreases in seconds or so.

[code]case 13666:

if(absX == #### && absX == ####) {
    500msTimer = 200;
if (timer == 100)
{ 
forceWalk(#, #);
timer-= 1;
}
if (timer == 99 && 500msTimer == 0) { 
setAnimation(####);
}

break;[/code]

Something like that.
And declare ‘500msTimer’ as 0

And in 500ms make it count down.

Read full topic

[quote=“Rog3r, post:7, topic:233764”]You would create another timer to count down by 1 in the 500ms and set it to 2000 so it would take 2 seconds for that.
Or, you can set it however you want so when you walk to the desired location, then what ever you set, you would do the animation.[/quote]

A timer for a timer? What about a loop? How would I use that in this scenario?

item.title: Timers-Odd and Even Numbers
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

You would create another timer to count down by 1 in the 500ms and set it to 2000 so it would take 2 seconds for that.
Or, you can set it however you want so when you walk to the desired location, then what ever you set, you would do the animation.

After the first case it adds one, and you don’t have to keep making the numbers over and over, you can just put the case into some boolean and it would automatically add another dialouge. You know what I’m talking about?

So maybe you can just use that concept.[/quote] I have no idea the concept you are speaking of. item.title: Timers-Odd and Even Numbers
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Uh, not sure if this would help but this reminds me of how npc dialouge is set up. After the first case it adds one, and you don’t have to keep making the numbers over and over, you can just put the case into some boolean and it would automatically add another dialouge. You know what I’m talking about?

So maybe you can just use that concept.

item.title: Timers-Odd and Even Numbers
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Ok, so I have a timer set=100 but I don’t want to decrease it by 1 every time until it reaches 0 because it would be doing the same 2 actions repeatedly 50 times each. So if I have

if (timer == 100)

and a code resembling this

if (timer == 100) { Action Here; timer -= 1; } if (timer == 99) { Action Here; }

How would I make it so the timers would recognize that every other number would be the same as before. If there is any way of doing this please let me know.

Tico135- Any help? You should be pretty good at Java seeing you are a moderator here.

Read full topic
